indication: Dyspnea, atrial fibrillation, heart failure - rule out pulmonary embolism
technique: Helical CT angiography of the chest was performed following IV administration of 80 mL Omnipaque 350 with bolus tracking technique. Images were acquired during a single breath-hold.

contrast.timing: Bolus tracking, trigger at main pulmonary artery

pulmonaryArteries.mainPA: No filling defect. Normal caliber (2.8 cm).
pulmonaryArteries.right: No pulmonary embolism. Segmental and subsegmental branches well opacified.
pulmonaryArteries.left: No pulmonary embolism. Segmental and subsegmental branches well opacified.

heart.leftVentricle: Dilated with wall thinning of the inferior wall.

lungs.parenchyma: Bibasilar dependent atelectasis. Mild interstitial edema with septal thickening. No consolidation.
lungs.pleura: Small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.

mediastinum.lymphNodes: No significant mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.
mediastinum.aorta: Atherosclerotic calcification of the thoracic aorta. No aneurysm or dissection.

findings.upperAbdomen: Limited evaluation. Surgical clips in the gallbladder fossa (status post cholecystectomy).

impression: Cardiomegaly with findings consistent with congestive heart failure including small bilateral pleural effusions, mild interstitial edema, and bibasilar atelectasis.
Atherosclerotic disease of the thoracic aorta.
recommendations: Consider diuretic adjustment for pulmonary edema
comparison: Chest X-ray dated 2022-05-15 showed cardiomegaly and pulmonary vascular congestion. Current study confirms findings and excludes PE.
